title: Crypt0Gore
author: Crypt0Gore
content: Is there any gambling/casino website that owns a android application? I noticed that all gambling websites are good for PC/Computers but not phones, I believe an android application will be flawless and way easier to access..

comments.author: piebeyb
comments.body: Quote from: Crypt0Gore on November 16, 2022, 06:54:13 AMIs there any gambling/casino website that owns a android application? I noticed that all gambling websites are good for PC/Computers but not phones, I believe an android application will be flawless and way easier to access.. Isn't using a cellphone browser any gambling site friendly enough, I always use a cellphone browser without having to use the app because I think it's more than enough and light, I've tried many games on several gambling sites and it's very easy to use even though I only rely on the browser from phone only, try using it

I noticed that all gambling websites are good for PC/Computers but not phones, I believe an android application will be flawless and way easier to access.. You can try Bitcasino.io applications which you can download from their website.Make sure you double check the site by visiting their ANN so you do not download the wrong applications.But as you can use android applications easily, you should have more control over yourself because this can make you forget everything and only play without stopping.This can attract you to become addicted for a long time.

comments.author: Oshosondy
comments.body: Quote from: Crypt0Gore on November 16, 2022, 06:54:13 AMIs there any gambling/casino website that owns a android application? I noticed that all gambling websites are good for PC/Computers but not phones, I believe an android application will be flawless and way easier to access.. Which android browser are you using? I have been using Chrome browser for long time now and it is good for those gambling sites. The only gambling site that I have its app was a fiat gambling site which I do not have to mention. First try and change your browser to see if the gambling experience is better. People nowadays are accessing gambling sites more on phones and have good experiences with it with better GUI.

comments.author: FatFork
comments.body: Quote from: Crypt0Gore on November 16, 2022, 06:54:13 AMIs there any gambling/casino website that owns a android application? As far as I know, only Bitcasino.io casino offers a stand-alone mobile app worth mentioning. You can find the download link on their website or in their ANN topic: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=4541166.0Quote from: Crypt0Gore on November 16, 2022, 06:54:13 AMI noticed that all gambling websites are good for PC/Computers but not phones, I believe an android application will be flawless and way easier to access.. The vast majority of online casinos feature both desktop and mobile versions of their sites, a design choice known as responsive design. Responsive design means that the site's layout changes to fit different screens. This means that whether you're accessing the casino on a desktop computer, laptop or tablet, you'll have access to all of the same features and games. I don't know what kind of problem you encountered, but I've played at many online casinos and can tell you that none of them have ever had a problem with my mobile browser. If you're having a technical issue, then it's likely that your device or its settings are causing it. First, make sure your device is up-to-date. If it's an old model, then it may not be compatible with newer games or features. Second, check to make sure that your mobile browser is fully updated and that you have the latest version. If you're still having problems, try using a different browser and see if the problem persists.

comments.author: Bitinity
comments.body: Quote from: Crypt0Gore on November 16, 2022, 06:54:13 AMIs there any gambling/casino website that owns a android application? I noticed that all gambling websites are good for PC/Computers but not phones, I believe an android application will be flawless and way easier to access.. There are some casinos provide their own android application such as bitcasino, bk8, megapari. Frankly, using browser is better than using application imo. As long as what I know, not all features that you can find in web browser can be implemented in the application. Means that web browser is still a lot of better than application. If you think that not all gambling sites are not good in phones, it means that the casino needs to improve their mobile version and you can suggest them to improve it.

comments.author: Wexnident
comments.body: Quote from: Crypt0Gore on November 16, 2022, 06:54:13 AMIs there any gambling/casino website that owns a android application? I noticed that all gambling websites are good for PC/Computers but not phones, I believe an android application will be flawless and way easier to access.. Pretty sure you can access casinos via mobile browsers. I reckon when the casino was in development, they already argued whether to make a mobile app or not, but seeing as the main platform for the casino was browsers, which encompass both pc and mobile, they saw no need for it. If they do try to develop an android application for it, they'd have to develop it for iOs as well. This can all be summed up as needless expense, which they can probably put out for better use. And in all honesty, accessing it via mobile browsers sounds fine already imo. It's not like casinos have some special features that request the necessity for it to become an application.

comments.body: Quote from: Oshosondy on November 16, 2022, 07:20:48 AMFrom my understanding i notice he is talking of application, a gambling site that has their application running meaning of you wanna place a bet or predict some game you could just open their Android Application or IOs application and make all your game and gambling using their own app instead of going through the web version of it.Normally many gambling and casino sites are being designed on a web version for faster and smart process and to give users the best experience.

comments.author: Solosanz
comments.body: Please explore the casino first rather than ask this question, there's many casinos has their own apps that can be installed by just clicking the icon. Actually it doesn't make any difference if you access the site via online or using their apps, actually install unknown apps in your phone is really dangerous since they can track your device and the other information that you give them access. I would prefer to access the site via online rather than using their apps.

comments.author: PX-Z
comments.body: Quote from: Crypt0Gore on November 16, 2022, 06:54:13 AMI believe an android application will be flawless and way easier to access.. Only for a certain games that doesn't have large scale screens or nothing much graphics on it, say dice. But for other games, sportsbetting, etc. i bet i would prefer a desktop size screens for much clearer and much better user experience.

Because what I often see are online casinos that are based on traditional business.Because the crypto gambling that I play is often only opened in browsing using browsers depending on the wishes of the individual who wants to play cryptocurrency gambling.

comments.author: Nrcewker
comments.body: Quote from: Crypt0Gore on November 16, 2022, 06:54:13 AMIs there any gambling/casino website that owns a android application? I noticed that all gambling websites are good for PC/Computers but not phones, I believe an android application will be flawless and way easier to access.. Gambling apps are prohibited in appstore and play store. This is the main reason for which many gambling sites and casinos don’t have any mobile apps. Rather they make sure that their sites are well responsive in all the mobile devices. Op have you tried the casinos in Chrome for android or Safari for Apple? These are the best browsers for the gambling sites. Also make sure that you use good casinos like stake.com . They have the best mobile version UI according to me.

comments.author: Team_MegaPari
comments.body: QuoteIs there any gambling/casino website that owns a android application? I noticed that all gambling websites are good for PC/Computers but not phones, I believe an android application will be flawless and way easier to access.. Hey. I believe applications in the gambling industry are highly unappreciated. Almost all companies tend to digitalize their services as their target audience spend half of their day in a smartphone. We love apps for convenience and snappy/user-friendly interface. MegaPari also has an application - our players actually adore it. Almost each positive review contains compliments to the application  In my signature you will find a link to our ANN thread and till 30. Nov new players get a higher bonus as a Black Friday offering.

comments.author: bittraffic
comments.body: As they said mobile browsers allow users to view websites just as they see desktop browsers.Don't trust apps by the way. Don't just install apps related to wallets, you don't know what could be in them. Installing an app means you give the program some level of permission to your drive. This could be risky for your coins so just be careful.

This could be risky for your coins so just be careful. this is what is worrying because we will never know in that application, people don't even think about the security of their cellphones that might store crypto in it, after losing they just realize that the application they installed takes all that access, actually it's enough to just use the browser any casino can be played because they are really friendly

comments.author: Daltonik
comments.body: Quote from: Crypt0Gore on November 16, 2022, 06:54:13 AMIs there any gambling/casino website that owns a android application? I noticed that all gambling websites are good for PC/Computers but not phones, I believe an android application will be flawless and way easier to access.. Well, as far as we know, some online casinos also have android applications, but I would not recommend using them since really trusted gambling platforms bypass them and this is primarily due to security issues and the possibility of scammers to take advantage of this to release a fake application and you will simply lose your funds.

comments.author: Fivestar4everMVP
comments.body: Quote from: Crypt0Gore on November 16, 2022, 06:54:13 AMIs there any gambling/casino website that owns a android application? I noticed that all gambling websites are good for PC/Computers but not phones, I believe an android application will be flawless and way easier to access.. Well, I don't know the kind of mobile phone you are using but I've actually been playing on stake.com from my mobile phone for sometime now, and I think it looks good and the experience has been very good so far.Although i must say that there is an app with stake logo on google play store, but i believe this app is fake since stake have never for once announced launching an app.And as for other casinos, i am not too sure, but i do know that there are several casino apps on google playstore but i can not tell how safe they are, my advice is that you be extremely careful not to end up downloading a fake scam app, i advice you stick with the most popular and reputable casinos here. If the websites do not fit well on your mobile device and you have the means, then maybe you should consider getting a bigger mobile device for a premium gambling experience.
